definition: to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt

sentences.english: Premium solvent, odourless and no harmful to skin.
sentences.chinese: 優質溶劑，無氣味，不傷皮膚。

sentences.english: They might be,for example,in an accident, and come close to being killed,but walk away without a scratch.
sentences.chinese: 比如說在事故中倖存，差點送命，但結果毫髮無傷。

sentences.english: Increased positive feelings and reduced feelings of anxiety, anger and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 增加正面的工作情緒，減少緊張，憤怒及懮傷。

sentences.english: Aunt is ready for you to eat the teeth do not hurt the sugar, to taste, welcome to.
sentences.chinese: 阿姨準備了適合你喫不傷牙齒的糖，歡迎到時來嚐嚐。

sentences.english: Three people were hospitalized with minor lacerations.
sentences.chinese: 有三個人因輕微撕裂傷住院。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the temple is believed to have escaped any damage.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，神廟毫髮無傷。

sentences.english: Pang shot an arrow at Guan who was unable to dodge it.
sentences.chinese: 龐德取箭，關羽躲閃不及中箭，回營養傷。

sentences.english: Efficient without a good soak decontamination vigorously scrub, do not hurt the clothing does not hurt the hand.
sentences.chinese: 高效好泡去污無需大力搓洗，不傷衣物不傷手。

sentences.english: Objective To discuss a new method to treat the incompleted exfoliated soft tissue.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討軟組織不完全剝脫傷治療的方法。

sentences.english: I just hope I didn't hurt anyone to the right side of the goal with my second shot!
sentences.chinese: 我希望沒有第二個打飛的點球沒有傷到球迷。

sentences.english: The pity for the physical injury, non-aromatic absolutely cherish years.
sentences.chinese: 所憐物性傷，非惜年芳絕。

sentences.english: He spoke with firmness, but his face was very sad and his eyes were dim.
sentences.chinese: 他講得很堅定，但臉色很悽傷，雙眼閃出悲觀的神情。

sentences.english: Yin Zu check day injury, estimated that he was hurt by the woman.
sentences.chinese: 尹祖檢查丁日傷勢，估計他被女子所傷。

sentences.english: The inoculation on unwounded bark surface caused no symptom, but new sprouts all became diseased after unwounded inoculation.
sentences.chinese: 無傷接種不產生症狀，但對嫩梢接種引起發病。

sentences.english: I got through without major injury.
sentences.chinese: 我在這幾年中，沒受過什麼大傷。

sentences.english: Thus, placing one near my vag could lead to a very unfortunate injury.
sentences.chinese: 所以，如果用刀片刮毛，很可能我會傷到自己。

definition: to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
